intro: Bridelia insulana, commonly known as the island bridelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Bridelia insulana is often found in littoral zones and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
